container-title: Safety and Reliability: Methodology and Applications

items.abstract:
<jats:title>Abstract</jats:title>
				<jats:p> To ensure that road transport safety measures are effective and efficient, forecast tools should be applied to help with strategic decision-making. Models of road safety measures provide such tools. The paper presents a proposed macro model of road accident casualties. The proposed models of road accident fatalities are built from a database covering more than fifty countries worldwide. The concepts of model design can be used for developing factor-based models to describe strategic societal risk on the road networks of selected countries worldwide. One of the concepts was applied to model the number of road accident fatalities. The analyses used Smeed’s model and its modifications developed for the needs of this analysis.</jats:p>
title: Macro Models of Casualties in Road Transport / Modelowanie Strat Osobowych W Transporcie Drogowym
subject: Safety, Risk, Reliability and Quality

items.abstract:
<jats:title>The Application of Risk Analysis in the Assessment and Management of Road Safety in Road Tunnels</jats:title>
        <jats:p>Road tunnels are highly sensitive to disturbance caused by road accidents. The most serious accidents occurring in tunnels involve trucks carrying hazardous materials. Europe has been developing methods of risk analysis and building models for traffic management in tunnels. Poland is only just beginning to build road tunnels and the area of tunnel safety has not been given adequate attention yet.</jats:p>
title: The Application of Risk Analysis in the Assessment and Management of Road Safety in Road Tunnels

items.abstract:
<jats:title>Review of Road Safety Theories and Models</jats:title>
        <jats:p>It has been 100 years since the first attempts at trying to explain why road accidents happen. There have been a number of theories and models studying this and road safety has become a field of scientific study. The paper will present how the theories and models of road safety developed and how they are used for road safety management. Four groups of the most advanced theories are distinguished: static theories, causal theories, system and behavioral theories. This division of the theories is followed in the models used for road safety analyses and studies.</jats:p>
title: Review of Road Safety Theories and Models

items.abstract:
<jats:title>Strategic Risk Measures in Road Traffic</jats:title>
        <jats:p>Strategic risk is a long-term risk which forms part of long-term decisions taken by organisations which manage road safety in a specific area. The strategic risk on a country's road network is the uncertainty about the strategic goal which is to protect road users from death and injury. When estimating risk in traffic engineering it is important to use the right measures of risk and methods for calculating or forecasting risk. The paper presents an analysis of macro level measures of strategic risk in road traffic.</jats:p>
title: Strategic Risk Measures in Road Traffic
